items.title: A Study Makes It Official: New York Is the Most Competitive City
items.abstract: A study, conducted for Citigroup by the Economist Intelligence Unit, ranked 120 cities on their competitiveness, based on their ability to attract investments, workers and tourists, among other attributes.

items.title: New Yorkers Shiver as Frigid Air Hits the City
items.abstract: After a couple of very mild winters, New Yorkers may have forgotten how quickly a truly cold day can chill right to the bone, but for the next few days, they will get a reminder.

items.title: Review: This is New York? An Urban Montage Traffics in the Well Worn
items.abstract: Jane Comfort and Company’s “You Are Here,” part of the American Dance Institute’s season at the Kitchen, is short on convincing aggression or malice.

items.title: Review: Ballet Hispanico’s ‘If Walls Could Speak’ Offers Vignettes of Urban Life
items.abstract: The dance company presented the premiere of this work by the Brazilian-born choreographer Fernando Melo, at the Apollo Theater.

items.title: More Than 5 Feet of Snow in Buffalo Area, and More Is Expected
items.abstract: A storm lasting through the weekend is underway on the eastern coasts of Lakes Erie and Ontario, with snowfall rates reaching over three inches per hour.
